AddressingGap.description: Was there a specific gap that needed to be filled by creation of the dataset?

description.description: A human-readable description for this property.

id.description: An optional identifier for this property.

name.description: A human-readable name for this property.

response.description: Short explanation of the knowledge or resource gap that this dataset was intended to address.

used_software.description: What software was used as part of this dataset property?

AddressingGap.title: AddressingGap

BiasTypeEnum.description: Types of bias that may be present in datasets. Values are mapped to the Artificial Intelligence Ontology (AIO) bias taxonomy from BioPortal. See https://bioportal.bioontology.org/ontologies/AIO
BiasTypeEnum.title: BiasTypeEnum

CRediTRoleEnum.description: Contributor roles based on the CRediT (Contributor Roles Taxonomy). See https://credit.niso.org/
CRediTRoleEnum.title: CRediTRoleEnum

CleaningStrategy.description: Was any cleaning of the data done (e.g., removal of instances, processing of missing values)?

cleaning_details.description: Details on data cleaning procedures applied.

description.description: A human-readable description for this property.

id.description: An optional identifier for this property.

name.description: A human-readable name for this property.

used_software.description: What software was used as part of this dataset property?

CleaningStrategy.title: CleaningStrategy

CollectionConsent.description: Did the individuals in question consent to the collection and use of their data? If so, how was consent requested and provided, and what language did individuals consent to?

consent_details.description: Details on how consent was requested, provided, and documented.

description.description: A human-readable description for this property.

id.description: An optional identifier for this property.

name.description: A human-readable name for this property.

used_software.description: What software was used as part of this dataset property?

CollectionConsent.title: CollectionConsent

CollectionMechanism.description: What mechanisms or procedures were used to collect the data (e.g., hardware, manual curation, software APIs)? Also covers how these mechanisms were validated.

description.description: A human-readable description for this property.

id.description: An optional identifier for this property.

mechanism_details.description: Details on mechanisms or procedures used to collect the data.

name.description: A human-readable name for this property.

used_software.description: What software was used as part of this dataset property?

CollectionMechanism.title: CollectionMechanism

CollectionNotification.description: Were the individuals in question notified about the data collection? If so, please describe (or show with screenshots, etc.) how notice was provided, and reproduce the language of the notification itself if possible.

description.description: A human-readable description for this property.

id.description: An optional identifier for this property.

name.description: A human-readable name for this property.

notification_details.description: Details on how individuals were notified about data collection.

used_software.description: What software was used as part of this dataset property?

CollectionNotification.title: CollectionNotification

CollectionTimeframe.description: Over what timeframe was the data collected, and does this timeframe match the creation timeframe of the underlying data?

description.description: A human-readable description for this property.

id.description: An optional identifier for this property.

name.description: A human-readable name for this property.

timeframe_details.description: Details on the collection timeframe and relationship to data creation dates.

used_software.description: What software was used as part of this dataset property?

CollectionTimeframe.title: CollectionTimeframe

ComplianceStatusEnum.description: Compliance status for regulatory frameworks. Indicates the extent to which a dataset complies with specific regulations (e.g., HIPAA, 45 CFR 46). These are workflow status values that may evolve as regulations are assessed or as the dataset is modified.
ComplianceStatusEnum.title: ComplianceStatusEnum

Confidentiality.description: Does the dataset contain data that might be confidential (e.g., protected by legal privilege, patient data, non-public communications)?

confidential_elements_present.description: Indicates whether any confidential data elements are present.

confidentiality_details.description: Details on confidential data elements and handling procedures.

description.description: A human-readable description for this property.

id.description: An optional identifier for this property.

name.description: A human-readable name for this property.

used_software.description: What software was used as part of this dataset property?

Confidentiality.title: Confidentiality

ConfidentialityLevelEnum.description:
Confidentiality classification levels for datasets indicating the degree of access restrictions and data sensitivity.
NOTE: This enum classifies data sensitivity and access control (WHO can access), which is orthogonal to DataUsePermissionEnum that specifies use restrictions (WHAT authorized users can do with data). ConfidentialityLevelEnum determines access requirements, while DataUsePermissionEnum uses DUO terms to specify permitted uses once access is granted.
ConfidentialityLevelEnum.title: ConfidentialityLevelEnum

ConsentRevocation.description: If consent was obtained, were the consenting individuals provided with a mechanism to revoke their consent in the future or for certain uses? If so, please describe.

description.description: A human-readable description for this property.

id.description: An optional identifier for this property.

name.description: A human-readable name for this property.

revocation_details.description: Details on consent revocation mechanisms and procedures.

used_software.description: What software was used as part of this dataset property?

ConsentRevocation.title: ConsentRevocation

ContentWarning.description: Does the dataset contain any data that might be offensive, insulting, threatening, or otherwise anxiety-provoking if viewed directly?

content_warnings_present.description: Indicates whether any content warnings are needed.

description.description: A human-readable description for this property.

id.description: An optional identifier for this property.

name.description: A human-readable name for this property.

used_software.description: What software was used as part of this dataset property?

ContentWarning.title: ContentWarning

Creator.description: Who created the dataset (e.g., which team, research group) and on behalf of which entity (e.g., company, institution, organization)? This may also be considered a team.

affiliations.description: Organizations with which the creator or team is affiliated.

credit_roles.description: Contributor roles using the CRediT (Contributor Roles Taxonomy) for the principal investigator or creator team. Specifies the specific contributions made to this dataset (e.g., Conceptualization, Data Curation, Methodology). Note: roles are specified here rather than on Person directly, since the same person may have different roles across different datasets.

description.description: A human-readable description for this property.

id.description: An optional identifier for this property.

name.description: A human-readable name for this property.

principal_investigator.description: A key individual (Principal Investigator) responsible for or overseeing dataset creation.

used_software.description: What software was used as part of this dataset property?

Creator.title: Creator

CreatorOrMaintainerEnum.description: Types of agents (persons or organizations) involved in dataset creation or maintenance. Mapped to schema.org organization types.
CreatorOrMaintainerEnum.title: CreatorOrMaintainerEnum

DataAnomaly.description: Are there any errors, sources of noise, or redundancies in the dataset?

anomaly_details.description: Details on errors, noise sources, or redundancies in the dataset.

description.description: A human-readable description for this property.

id.description: An optional identifier for this property.

name.description: A human-readable name for this property.

used_software.description: What software was used as part of this dataset property?

DataAnomaly.title: DataAnomaly

DataCollector.description: Who was involved in the data collection (e.g., students, crowdworkers, contractors), and how they were compensated.

collector_details.description: Details on who collected the data and their compensation.

description.description: A human-readable description for this property.

id.description: An optional identifier for this property.

name.description: A human-readable name for this property.

role.description: Role of the data collector (e.g., researcher, crowdworker)

used_software.description: What software was used as part of this dataset property?

DataCollector.title: DataCollector

DataProtectionImpact.description: Has an analysis of the potential impact of the dataset and its use on data subjects (e.g., a data protection impact analysis) been conducted? If so, please provide a description of this analysis, including the outcomes, and any supporting documentation.

description.description: A human-readable description for this property.

id.description: An optional identifier for this property.

impact_details.description: Details on data protection impact analysis, outcomes, and documentation.

name.description: A human-readable name for this property.

used_software.description: What software was used as part of this dataset property?

DataProtectionImpact.title: DataProtectionImpact

DataSubset.description: A subset of a dataset, likely containing multiple files of multiple potential purposes and properties.

bytes.description: Size of the data in bytes.

citation.description: Recommended citation for this dataset in DataCite or BibTeX format. Provides a standard way to cite the dataset in publications.

compression.description: compression format used, if any. e.g., gzip, bzip2, zip

description.description: A human-readable description for a thing.

download_url.description: URL from which the data can be downloaded. This is not the same as the landing page, which is a page that describes the dataset. Rather, this URL points directly to the data itself.

encoding.description: the character encoding of the data

external_resources.description: Links or identifiers for external resources. Can be used either as a list of ExternalResource objects (in Dataset) or as a list of URL strings (within ExternalResource class).

format.description: The file format, physical medium, or dimensions of a resource. This should be a file extension or MIME type.

human_subject_research.description: Information about whether dataset involves human subjects research, including IRB approval, ethics review, and regulatory compliance.

id.description: A unique identifier for a thing.

informed_consent.description: Details about informed consent procedures, including consent type, documentation, and withdrawal mechanisms.

intended_uses.description: Explicit intended and recommended uses for this dataset. Complements future_use_impacts by focusing on positive applications.

is_data_split.description: Is this subset a split of the larger dataset, e.g., is it a set for model training, testing, or validation?

is_subpopulation.description: Is this subset a subpopulation of the larger dataset, e.g., is it a set of data for a specific demographic?

known_biases.description: Known biases present in the dataset that may affect fairness, representativeness, or model performance. Uses BiasTypeEnum for standardized bias categorization mapped to the AI Ontology (AIO).

known_limitations.description: Known limitations of the dataset that may affect its use or interpretation. Distinct from biases (systematic errors) and anomalies (data quality issues).

language.description: language in which the information is expressed

media_type.description: The media type of the data. This should be a MIME type.

name.description: A human-readable name for a thing.

parent_datasets.description: Parent datasets that this dataset is part of or derived from. Enables hierarchical dataset composition (hasPart/isPartOf relationships).

participant_compensation.description: Compensation or incentives provided to human research participants.

participant_privacy.description: Privacy protections and anonymization procedures for human research participants, including reidentification risk assessment.

prohibited_uses.description: Explicitly prohibited or forbidden uses for this dataset. Stronger than discouraged_uses - these are not permitted.

related_datasets.description: Related datasets with typed relationships (e.g., supplements, derives from, is version of). Use DatasetRelationship class to specify relationship types.

resources.description: Sub-resources or component datasets that are part of this dataset. Allows datasets to contain nested resource structures.

title.description: the official title of the element

variables.description: Metadata describing individual variables, fields, or columns in the dataset.

vulnerable_populations.description: Information about protections for vulnerable populations (e.g., minors, pregnant women, prisoners) including special safeguards and assent procedures.

DataSubset.title: DataSubset

DataUsePermissionEnum.description: Data use permissions and restrictions based on the Data Use Ontology (DUO). DUO is a standardized ontology for representing data use conditions developed by GA4GH. See https://github.com/EBISPOT/DUO
DataUsePermissionEnum.title: DataUsePermissionEnum

Dataset.description: A single component of related observations and/or information that can be read, manipulated, transformed, and otherwise interpreted.

bytes.description: Size of the data in bytes.

citation.description: Recommended citation for this dataset in DataCite or BibTeX format. Provides a standard way to cite the dataset in publications.

compression.description: compression format used, if any. e.g., gzip, bzip2, zip

description.description: A human-readable description for a thing.

download_url.description: URL from which the data can be downloaded. This is not the same as the landing page, which is a page that describes the dataset. Rather, this URL points directly to the data itself.

encoding.description: the character encoding of the data

external_resources.description: Links or identifiers for external resources. Can be used either as a list of ExternalResource objects (in Dataset) or as a list of URL strings (within ExternalResource class).

format.description: The file format, physical medium, or dimensions of a resource. This should be a file extension or MIME type.

id.description: A unique identifier for a thing.

informed_consent.description: Details about informed consent procedures, including consent type, documentation, and withdrawal mechanisms.

intended_uses.description: Explicit intended and recommended uses for this dataset. Complements future_use_impacts by focusing on positive applications.

known_biases.description: Known biases present in the dataset that may affect fairness, representativeness, or model performance. Uses BiasTypeEnum for standardized bias categorization mapped to the AI Ontology (AIO).

known_limitations.description: Known limitations of the dataset that may affect its use or interpretation. Distinct from biases (systematic errors) and anomalies (data quality issues).

language.description: language in which the information is expressed

media_type.description: The media type of the data. This should be a MIME type.

name.description: A human-readable name for a thing.

parent_datasets.description: Parent datasets that this dataset is part of or derived from. Enables hierarchical dataset composition (hasPart/isPartOf relationships).

participant_compensation.description: Compensation or incentives provided to human research participants.

participant_privacy.description: Privacy protections and anonymization procedures for human research participants, including reidentification risk assessment.

prohibited_uses.description: Explicitly prohibited or forbidden uses for this dataset. Stronger than discouraged_uses - these are not permitted.

related_datasets.description: Related datasets with typed relationships (e.g., supplements, derives from, is version of). Use DatasetRelationship class to specify relationship types.

resources.description: Sub-resources or component datasets that are part of this dataset. Allows datasets to contain nested resource structures.

title.description: the official title of the element

variables.description: Metadata describing individual variables, fields, or columns in the dataset.

vulnerable_populations.description: Information about protections for vulnerable populations (e.g., minors, pregnant women, prisoners) including special safeguards and assent procedures.

Dataset.title: Dataset

DatasetBias.description: Documents known biases present in the dataset. Biases are systematic errors or prejudices that may affect the representativeness or fairness of the data. Distinct from anomalies (data quality issues) and limitations (scope constraints).

affected_subsets.description: Specific subsets or features of the dataset affected by this bias.

bias_description.description: Detailed description of how this bias manifests in the dataset, including affected populations, features, or outcomes.

bias_type.description: The type of bias identified, using standardized categories from the Artificial Intelligence Ontology (AIO).

description.description: A human-readable description for this property.

id.description: An optional identifier for this property.

mitigation_strategy.description: Steps taken or recommended to mitigate this bias.

name.description: A human-readable name for this property.

used_software.description: What software was used as part of this dataset property?

DatasetBias.title: DatasetBias

DatasetCollection.description: A collection of related datasets, likely containing multiple files of multiple potential purposes and properties.

compression.description: compression format used, if any. e.g., gzip, bzip2, zip

description.description: A human-readable description for a thing.

download_url.description: URL from which the data can be downloaded. This is not the same as the landing page, which is a page that describes the dataset. Rather, this URL points directly to the data itself.

id.description: A unique identifier for a thing.

language.description: language in which the information is expressed

name.description: A human-readable name for a thing.

DatasetLimitation.description: Documents known limitations of the dataset that may affect its use or interpretation. Distinct from biases (systematic errors) and anomalies (data quality issues).

description.description: A human-readable description for this property.

id.description: An optional identifier for this property.

limitation_description.description: Detailed description of the limitation and its implications.

limitation_type.description: Category of limitation (e.g., scope, coverage, temporal, methodological).

name.description: A human-readable name for this property.

recommended_mitigation.description: Recommended approaches for users to address this limitation.

scope_impact.description: How this limitation affects the scope or applicability of the dataset.

used_software.description: What software was used as part of this dataset property?

DatasetLimitation.title: DatasetLimitation

DatasetProperty.description: Represents a single property of a dataset, or a set of related properties.

description.description: A human-readable description for this property.

id.description: An optional identifier for this property.

name.description: A human-readable name for this property.

used_software.description: What software was used as part of this dataset property?

DatasetProperty.title: DatasetProperty

DatasetRelationship.description: Typed relationship to another dataset, enabling precise specification of how datasets relate to each other (e.g., supplements, derives from, is version of). Supports RO-Crate-style dataset interlinking.

description.description: Free-text description providing additional context about the relationship.

id.description: An optional identifier for this property.

name.description: A human-readable name for this property.

relationship_type.description: The type of relationship (e.g., derives_from, supplements, is_version_of). Uses DatasetRelationshipTypeEnum for standardized relationship types.

target_dataset.description: The dataset that this relationship points to. Can be specified by identifier, URL, or Dataset object.

used_software.description: What software was used as part of this dataset property?

DatasetRelationship.title: DatasetRelationship

DatasetRelationshipTypeEnum.description: Standardized types of relationships between datasets, based on DataCite Metadata Schema RelationType controlled vocabulary and Dublin Core relationship terms. See https://datacite-metadata-schema.readthedocs.io/ and http://purl.org/dc/terms/
DatasetRelationshipTypeEnum.title: DatasetRelationshipTypeEnum

Deidentification.description: Is it possible to identify individuals in the dataset, either directly or indirectly (in combination with other data)?

description.description: A human-readable description for this property.

id.description: An optional identifier for this property.

identifiable_elements_present.description: Indicates whether data subjects can be identified.

identifiers_removed.description: List of identifier types removed during de-identification.

method.description: Method used for de-identification (e.g., HIPAA Safe Harbor).

name.description: A human-readable name for this property.

is_direct.description: Whether collection was direct from individuals

name.description: A human-readable name for this property.

release_dates.description: Dates or timeframe for dataset release. Could be a one-time release date or multiple scheduled releases.

EthicalReview.description: Were any ethical or compliance review processes conducted (e.g., by an institutional review board)? If so, please provide a description of these review processes, including the frequency of review and documentation of outcomes, as well as a link or other access point to any supporting documentation.

contact_person.description: Contact person for questions about ethical review. Provides structured contact information including name, email, affiliation, and optional ORCID.

description.description: A human-readable description for this property.

id.description: An optional identifier for this property.

name.description: A human-readable name for this property.

review_details.description: Details on ethical review processes, outcomes, and supporting documentation.

reviewing_organization.description: Organization that conducted the ethical review (e.g., Institutional Review Board, Ethics Committee, Research Ethics Board). Provides information about the body responsible for ethical oversight.

description.description: A human-readable description for this property.

examples.description: List of examples of known/previous uses of the dataset.

id.description: An optional identifier for this property.

name.description: A human-readable name for this property.

ExportControlRegulatoryRestrictions.description: Do any export controls or other regulatory restrictions apply to the dataset or to individual instances? Includes compliance tracking for regulations like HIPAA and other US regulations. If so, please describe these restrictions and provide a link or copy of any supporting documentation. Maps to DUO terms related to ethics approval, geographic restrictions, and institutional requirements.

confidentiality_level.description: Confidentiality classification of the dataset indicating level of access restrictions and sensitivity.

description.description: A human-readable description for this property.

governance_committee_contact.description: Contact person for data governance committee. This person can answer questions about data governance policies, access procedures, and oversight mechanisms.

hipaa_compliant.description: Indicates compliance with the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA). HIPAA applies to protected health information in the United States.

id.description: An optional identifier for this property.

name.description: A human-readable name for this property.

other_compliance.description: Other regulatory compliance frameworks applicable to this dataset (e.g., CCPA, PIPEDA, industry-specific regulations).

regulatory_restrictions.description: Export or regulatory restrictions on the dataset.

used_software.description: What software was used as part of this dataset property?

description.description: A human-readable description for this property.

description.description: A human-readable description for this property.

external_resources.description: List of links or identifiers for external resources.

future_guarantees.description: Explanation of any commitments that external resources will remain available and stable over time.

name.description: A human-readable name for this property.

restrictions.description: Description of any restrictions or fees associated with external resources.

grants.description: Grant mechanisms supporting dataset creation. Multiple grants may fund a single dataset.

involves_human_subjects.description: Does this dataset involve human subjects research?

irb_approval.description: Was Institutional Review Board (IRB) approval obtained? Include approval number and institution if applicable.

Instance.description: What do the instances that comprise the dataset represent (e.g., documents, photos, people, countries)?

counts.description: How many instances are there in total (of each type, if appropriate)?

data_substrate.description: Type of data (e.g., raw text, images) from Bridge2AI standards.

data_topic.description: General topic of each instance (e.g., from Bridge2AI standards).

description.description: A human-readable description for this property.

id.description: An optional identifier for this property.

instance_type.description: Multiple types of instances? (e.g., movies, users, and ratings).

label.description: Is there a label or target associated with each instance?

label_description.description: If labeled, what pattern or format do labels follow?

missing_information.description: References to one or more MissingInfo objects describing missing data.

name.description: A human-readable name for this property.

sampling_strategies.description: References to one or more SamplingStrategy objects.

used_software.description: What software was used as part of this dataset property?

Instance.title: Instance

InstanceAcquisition.description: Describes how data associated with each instance was acquired (e.g., directly observed, reported by subjects, inferred).

acquisition_details.description: Details on how data was acquired for each instance.

description.description: A human-readable description for this property.

id.description: An optional identifier for this property.

name.description: A human-readable name for this property.

used_software.description: What software was used as part of this dataset property?

was_directly_observed.description: Whether the data was directly observed

was_inferred_derived.description: Whether the data was inferred or derived from other data

was_reported_by_subjects.description: Whether the data was reported directly by the subjects themselves

was_validated_verified.description: Whether the data was validated or verified in any way

InstanceAcquisition.title: InstanceAcquisition

IntendedUse.description: Explicit statement of intended uses for this dataset. Complements FutureUseImpact by focusing on positive, recommended applications rather than risks. Aligns with RO-Crate "Intended Use" field.

description.description: A human-readable description for this property.

examples.description: List of example intended uses for this dataset.

id.description: An optional identifier for this property.

name.description: A human-readable name for this property.

usage_notes.description: Notes or caveats about using the dataset for intended purposes.

use_category.description: Category of intended use (e.g., research, clinical, educational, commercial, policy).

used_software.description: What software was used as part of this dataset property?

IntendedUse.title: IntendedUse

LabelingStrategy.description: Was any labeling of the data done (e.g., part-of-speech tagging)? This class documents the annotation process and quality metrics.

annotation_platform.description: Platform or tool used for annotation (e.g., Label Studio, Prodigy, Amazon Mechanical Turk, custom annotation tool).

annotations_per_item.description: Number of annotations collected per data item. Multiple annotations per item enable calculation of inter-annotator agreement.

annotator_demographics.description: Demographic information about annotators, if available and relevant (e.g., geographic location, language background, expertise level).

description.description: A human-readable description for this property.

id.description: An optional identifier for this property.

inter_annotator_agreement.description: Measure of agreement between annotators (e.g., Cohen's kappa, Fleiss' kappa, Krippendorff's alpha, percent agreement). Include both the metric name and value.

labeling_details.description: Details on labeling/annotation procedures and quality metrics.

name.description: A human-readable name for this property.

used_software.description: What software was used as part of this dataset property?

LabelingStrategy.title: LabelingStrategy

LicenseAndUseTerms.description: Will the dataset be distributed under a copyright or other IP license, and/or under applicable terms of use? Provide a link or copy of relevant licensing terms and any fees.

contact_person.description: Contact person for licensing questions. Provides structured contact information including name, email, affiliation, and optional ORCID. This person can answer questions about licensing terms, usage restrictions, fees, and permissions.

data_use_permission.description: Structured data use permissions using the Data Use Ontology (DUO). Specifies permitted uses (e.g., general research, health/medical research, disease-specific research) and restrictions (e.g., non-commercial use, ethics approval required, collaboration required). See https://github.com/EBISPOT/DUO

description.description: A human-readable description for this property.

id.description: An optional identifier for this property.

license_terms.description: Description of the dataset's license and terms of use (including links, costs, or usage constraints).

name.description: A human-readable name for this property.

used_software.description: What software was used as part of this dataset property?

LicenseAndUseTerms.title: LicenseAndUseTerms

LimitationTypeEnum.description: Types of limitations that may affect dataset use or interpretation. Distinct from biases (systematic errors) and anomalies (data quality issues).
LimitationTypeEnum.title: LimitationTypeEnum

Maintainer.description: Who will be supporting/hosting/maintaining the dataset?

description.description: A human-readable description for this property.

id.description: An optional identifier for this property.

maintainer_details.description: Details on who will support, host, or maintain the dataset.

name.description: A human-readable name for this property.

role.description: Role of the maintainer (e.g., researcher, platform, organization).

used_software.description: What software was used as part of this dataset property?

Maintainer.title: Maintainer

MissingInfo.description: Is any information missing from individual instances? (e.g., unavailable data)

description.description: A human-readable description for this property.

id.description: An optional identifier for this property.

missing.description: Description of the missing data fields or elements.

name.description: A human-readable name for this property.

used_software.description: What software was used as part of this dataset property?

why_missing.description: Explanation of why each piece of data is missing.

MissingInfo.title: MissingInfo

NamedThing.description: A generic grouping for any identifiable entity.

description.description: A human-readable description for a thing.

id.description: A unique identifier for a thing.

name.description: A human-readable name for a thing.

NamedThing.title: NamedThing

description.description: A human-readable description for a thing.

id.description: A unique identifier for a thing.

name.description: A human-readable name for a thing.

OtherTask.description: What other tasks could the dataset be used for?

description.description: A human-readable description for this property.

id.description: An optional identifier for this property.

name.description: A human-readable name for this property.

task_details.description: Details on other potential tasks the dataset could be used for.

used_software.description: What software was used as part of this dataset property?

OtherTask.title: OtherTask

ParticipantPrivacy.description: Information about privacy protections and anonymization procedures for human research participants.

anonymization_method.description: What methods were used to anonymize or de-identify participant data? Include technical details of privacy-preserving techniques.

data_linkage.description: Can this dataset be linked to other datasets in ways that might compromise participant privacy?

description.description: A human-readable description for this property.

id.description: An optional identifier for this property.

name.description: A human-readable name for this property.

privacy_techniques.description: What privacy-preserving techniques were applied (e.g., differential privacy, k-anonymity, data masking)?

reidentification_risk.description: What is the assessed risk of re-identification? What measures were taken to minimize this risk?

used_software.description: What software was used as part of this dataset property?

ParticipantPrivacy.title: ParticipantPrivacy

Person.description: An individual human being. This class represents a person in the context of a specific dataset. Attributes like affiliation and email represent the person's current or most relevant contact information for this dataset. For stable cross-dataset identification, use the ORCID field. Note that contributor roles (CRediT) are specified in the usage context (e.g., Creator class) rather than on the Person directly, since roles vary by dataset.

affiliation.description: The organization(s) to which the person belongs in the context of this dataset. May vary across datasets; multivalued to support multiple affiliations.

description.description: A human-readable description for a thing.

email.description: The email address of the person. Represents current/preferred contact information in the context of this dataset.

id.description: A unique identifier for a thing.

name.description: A human-readable name for a thing.

orcid.description: ORCID (Open Researcher and Contributor ID) - a persistent digital identifier for researchers. Format: 0000-0000-0000-0000 (16 digits in groups of 4). Use this for stable cross-dataset identification.

Person.title: Person

PreprocessingStrategy.description: Was any preprocessing of the data done (e.g., discretization or bucketing, tokenization, SIFT feature extraction)?

description.description: A human-readable description for this property.

id.description: An optional identifier for this property.

name.description: A human-readable name for this property.

preprocessing_details.description: Details on preprocessing steps applied to the data.

used_software.description: What software was used as part of this dataset property?

PreprocessingStrategy.title: PreprocessingStrategy

ProhibitedUse.description: Explicit statement of prohibited or forbidden uses for this dataset. Stronger than DiscouragedUse - these are uses that are explicitly not permitted by license, ethics, or policy. Aligns with RO-Crate "Prohibited Uses" field.

description.description: A human-readable description for this property.

id.description: An optional identifier for this property.

name.description: A human-readable name for this property.

prohibition_reason.description: Reason why this use is prohibited (e.g., license restriction, ethical concern, privacy risk, legal constraint).

used_software.description: What software was used as part of this dataset property?

ProhibitedUse.title: ProhibitedUse

Purpose.description: For what purpose was the dataset created?

description.description: A human-readable description for this property.

id.description: An optional identifier for this property.

name.description: A human-readable name for this property.

response.description: Short explanation describing the primary purpose of creating the dataset.

used_software.description: What software was used as part of this dataset property?

Purpose.title: Purpose

RawData.description: Was the "raw" data saved in addition to the preprocessed/cleaned/labeled data? If so, please provide a link or other access point to the "raw" data.

access_url.description: URL or access point for the raw data.

description.description: A human-readable description for this property.

id.description: An optional identifier for this property.

name.description: A human-readable name for this property.

raw_data_details.description: Details on raw data availability and access procedures.

used_software.description: What software was used as part of this dataset property?

RawData.title: RawData

Relationships.description: Are relationships between individual instances made explicit (e.g., users' movie ratings, social network links)?

description.description: A human-readable description for this property.

id.description: An optional identifier for this property.

name.description: A human-readable name for this property.

relationship_details.description: Details on relationships between instances (e.g., graph edges, ratings).

used_software.description: What software was used as part of this dataset property?

Relationships.title: Relationships

RetentionLimits.description: If the dataset relates to people, are there applicable limits on the retention of their data (e.g., were individuals told their data would be deleted after a certain time)? If so, please describe these limits and how they will be enforced.

description.description: A human-readable description for this property.

id.description: An optional identifier for this property.

name.description: A human-readable name for this property.

retention_details.description: Details on data retention limits and enforcement procedures.

used_software.description: What software was used as part of this dataset property?

RetentionLimits.title: RetentionLimits

SamplingStrategy.description: Does the dataset contain all possible instances, or is it a sample (not necessarily random) of instances from a larger set? If so, how representative is it?

description.description: A human-readable description for this property.

id.description: An optional identifier for this property.

is_random.description: Indicates whether the sample is random.

is_representative.description: Indicates whether the sample is representative of the larger set.

is_sample.description: Indicates whether it is a sample of a larger set.

name.description: A human-readable name for this property.

representative_verification.description: Explanation of how representativeness was validated or verified.

source_data.description: Description of the larger set from which the sample was drawn, if any.

strategies.description: Description of the sampling strategy (deterministic, probabilistic, etc.).

used_software.description: What software was used as part of this dataset property?

why_not_representative.description: Explanation of why the sample is not representative, if applicable.

SamplingStrategy.title: SamplingStrategy

SensitiveElement.description: Does the dataset contain data that might be considered sensitive (e.g., race, sexual orientation, religion, biometrics)?

description.description: A human-readable description for this property.

id.description: An optional identifier for this property.

name.description: A human-readable name for this property.

sensitive_elements_present.description: Indicates whether sensitive data elements are present.

sensitivity_details.description: Details on sensitive data elements present and handling procedures.

used_software.description: What software was used as part of this dataset property?

SensitiveElement.title: SensitiveElement

description.description: A human-readable description for a thing.

id.description: A unique identifier for a thing.

name.description: A human-readable name for a thing.

Splits.description: Are there recommended data splits (e.g., training, validation, testing)? If so, how are they defined and why?

description.description: A human-readable description for this property.

id.description: An optional identifier for this property.

name.description: A human-readable name for this property.

split_details.description: Details on recommended data splits and their rationale.

used_software.description: What software was used as part of this dataset property?

Splits.title: Splits

Subpopulation.description: Does the dataset identify any subpopulations (e.g., by age, gender)? If so, how are they identified and what are their distributions?

description.description: A human-readable description for this property.

id.description: An optional identifier for this property.

name.description: A human-readable name for this property.

subpopulation_elements_present.description: Indicates whether any subpopulations are explicitly identified.

used_software.description: What software was used as part of this dataset property?

Subpopulation.title: Subpopulation

Task.description: Was there a specific task in mind for the dataset's application?

description.description: A human-readable description for this property.

id.description: An optional identifier for this property.

name.description: A human-readable name for this property.

response.description: Short explanation describing the specific task or tasks for which this dataset was created.

used_software.description: What software was used as part of this dataset property?

Task.title: Task

ThirdPartySharing.description: Will the dataset be distributed to third parties outside of the entity (e.g., company, institution, organization) on behalf of which the dataset was created?

description.description: A human-readable description for this property.

id.description: An optional identifier for this property.

is_shared.description: Boolean indicating whether the dataset is distributed to parties external to the dataset-creating entity.

name.description: A human-readable name for this property.

used_software.description: What software was used as part of this dataset property?

ThirdPartySharing.title: ThirdPartySharing

UpdatePlan.description: Will the dataset be updated (e.g., to correct labeling errors, add new instances, delete instances)? If so, how often, by whom, and how will these updates be communicated?

description.description: A human-readable description for this property.

frequency.description: How often updates are planned (e.g., quarterly, annually).

id.description: An optional identifier for this property.

name.description: A human-readable name for this property.

update_details.description: Details on update plans, responsible parties, and communication methods.

used_software.description: What software was used as part of this dataset property?

UpdatePlan.title: UpdatePlan

UseRepository.description: Is there a repository that links to any or all papers or systems that use the dataset? If so, provide a link or other access point.

description.description: A human-readable description for this property.

id.description: An optional identifier for this property.

name.description: A human-readable name for this property.

repository_details.description: Details on the repository of known dataset uses.

repository_url.description: URL to a repository of known dataset uses.

used_software.description: What software was used as part of this dataset property?

UseRepository.title: UseRepository

VariableMetadata.description: Metadata describing an individual variable, field, or column in a dataset. Variables may represent measurements, observations, derived values, or categorical attributes.

categories.description: The permitted categories or values for a categorical variable. Each entry should describe a possible value and its meaning.

data_type.description: The data type of the variable (e.g., integer, float, string, boolean, date, categorical). Use standard type names when possible.

derivation.description: Description of how this variable was derived or calculated from other variables, if applicable.

description.description: A human-readable description for this property.

examples.description: Example values for this variable to illustrate typical data.

id.description: An optional identifier for this property.

is_identifier.description: Indicates whether this variable serves as a unique identifier or key for records in the dataset.

is_sensitive.description: Indicates whether this variable contains sensitive information (e.g., personal data, protected health information).

maximum_value.description: The maximum value that the variable can take. Applicable to numeric variables.

measurement_technique.description: The technique or method used to measure this variable. Examples: "mass spectrometry", "self-report survey", "GPS coordinates".

minimum_value.description: The minimum value that the variable can take. Applicable to numeric variables.

missing_value_code.description: Code(s) used to represent missing values for this variable. Examples: "NA", "-999", "null", "". Multiple codes may be specified.

name.description: A human-readable name for this property.

precision.description: The precision or number of decimal places for numeric variables.

quality_notes.description: Notes about data quality, reliability, or known issues specific to this variable.

unit.description: The unit of measurement for the variable, preferably using QUDT units (http://qudt.org/vocab/unit/). Examples: qudt:Kilogram, qudt:Meter, qudt:DegreeCelsius.

used_software.description: What software was used as part of this dataset property?

variable_name.description: The name or identifier of the variable as it appears in the data files.

VariableMetadata.title: VariableMetadata

VariableTypeEnum.description: Common data types for variables. Values are mapped to schema.org DataType vocabulary. See https://schema.org/DataType
VariableTypeEnum.title: VariableTypeEnum

VersionAccess.description: Will older versions of the dataset continue to be supported/hosted/maintained? If so, how? If not, how will obsolescence be communicated to dataset consumers?

description.description: A human-readable description for this property.

id.description: An optional identifier for this property.

latest_version_doi.description: DOI or URL of the latest dataset version.

name.description: A human-readable name for this property.

used_software.description: What software was used as part of this dataset property?

version_details.description: Details on version support policies and obsolescence communication.

versions_available.description: List of available versions with metadata.

VersionAccess.title: VersionAccess

VersionTypeEnum.description: Type of version change using semantic versioning principles. See https://semver.org/
VersionTypeEnum.title: VersionTypeEnum

VulnerablePopulations.description: Information about protections for vulnerable populations in human subjects research.

assent_procedures.description: For research involving minors, what assent procedures were used? How was developmentally appropriate assent obtained?

description.description: A human-readable description for this property.

guardian_consent.description: For participants unable to provide their own consent, how was guardian or surrogate consent obtained?

id.description: An optional identifier for this property.

name.description: A human-readable name for this property.

special_protections.description: What additional protections were implemented for vulnerable populations? Include safeguards, modified procedures, or additional oversight.

used_software.description: What software was used as part of this dataset property?

vulnerable_groups_included.description: Are any vulnerable populations included (e.g., children, pregnant women, prisoners, cognitively impaired individuals)?

VulnerablePopulations.title: VulnerablePopulations

description: A collection of related datasets, likely containing multiple files of multiple potential purposes and properties.

compression.description: compression format used, if any. e.g., gzip, bzip2, zip

description.description: A human-readable description for a thing.

download_url.description: URL from which the data can be downloaded. This is not the same as the landing page, which is a page that describes the dataset. Rather, this URL points directly to the data itself.

id.description: A unique identifier for a thing.

language.description: language in which the information is expressed

name.description: A human-readable name for a thing.

title.description: the official title of the element

title: data-sheets-schema
